update.description:
This is another API change. It affects the way a Node is created. Now, a node will only accept one optional parameter of type `NodeOptions` that contains all options to be applied to your node. For now, the only options allowed are the ability to change the default namespace and partition name. 

This change will allow to extend the number of options in the future without breaking the API.

CI results:

* [Trusty is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64/28/).
* [Homebrew is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/22/).
* [Windows is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/59/).
update.title: Node options

update.description:
This is another API change. It affects the way a Node is created. Now, a node will only accept one optional parameter of type `NodeOptions` that contains all options to be applied to your node. For now, the only options allowed are the ability to change the default namespace and partition name. 

This change will allow to extend the number of options in the future without breaking the API.

update.title: Node options

content.raw: :+1:  that's great!
content.html: :+1: that's great!

content.raw: Yep, right now, namespaces and partitions are validated in the same way so I used the `IsValidNamespace()` function for both. It's a bit confusing so it's changed in the other branch.
content.html: Yep, right now, namespaces and partitions are validated in the same way so I used the IsValidNamespace() function for both. It's a bit confusing so it's changed in the other branch.

content.raw: I didn't it would be complicated. You can ignore my comment.
content.html: I didn't it would be complicated. You can ignore my comment.

content.raw: Ah sorry, that's only on your other branch. Nevermind
content.html: Ah sorry, that's only on your other branch. Nevermind

content.raw: `IsValidPartition`?
content.html: IsValidPartition?

content.raw: That would be problematic because the destructor needs to know the complete type of NodeOptionsPrivate for deallocation. I think this would require to declare `NodeOptionsPrivate` instead of forward declare it, which would break the opaque pointer. Maybe there's a workaround for this but I don't know it.
content.html: That would be problematic because the destructor needs to know the complete type of NodeOptionsPrivate for deallocation. I think this would require to declare NodeOptionsPrivate instead of forward declare it, which would break the opaque pointer. Maybe there's a workaround for this but I don't know it.

content.raw: I have [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/branches/compare/validate_partition%0Dnode_options#diff) branch waiting on my internal queue that adds more documentation. Check it out and let me know if you think we should edit something there.
content.html: I have this branch waiting on my internal queue that adds more documentation. Check it out and let me know if you think we should edit something there.

content.raw:
Reviewing the PR I noticed that there was no test or example for the removed constructor. I checked coverage and function coverage is about 92%. But all the functions introduced in this PR are fully covered.

![igntransp_cov.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/og7EBq/images/576602616-igntransp_cov.png)
content.html: Reviewing the PR I noticed that there was no test or example for the removed constructor. I checked coverage and function coverage is about 92%. But all the functions introduced in this PR are fully covered.

content.raw: Ok, thanks. I also just noticed that `Node::Options()` is private.
content.html: Ok, thanks. I also just noticed that Node::Options() is private.

content.raw: Oops, I hadn't even noticed that they were both namespace, nice catch!
content.html: Oops, I hadn't even noticed that they were both namespace, nice catch!

content.raw: It's not possible, only when you create the node.
content.html: It's not possible, only when you create the node.

content.raw: Added in b7630e4
content.html: Added in b7630e4

update.title: Node options

content.raw: Just checking, should it be possible to change partition and namespace after the node has been created? If so, maybe we need some tests with `node->Options()->SetPartition("aaa")`.
content.html: Just checking, should it be possible to change partition and namespace after the node has been created? If so, maybe we need some tests with node->Options()->SetPartition("aaa").

content.raw: Same for partition below
content.html: Same for partition below

content.raw:
How about besides checking that it was false, checking that the namespace is still the default (empty)?
`EXPECT_EQ(opts.NameSpace(), "");`
content.html: How about besides checking that it was false, checking that the namespace is still the default (empty)? EXPECT_EQ(opts.NameSpace(), "");

content.raw: Maybe mention here (or somewhere else) that the default partition name will be set by `IGN_PARTITION`, and if that's not set or valid, it will be `hostname() + ":" + username();` (if I understood well)
content.html: Maybe mention here (or somewhere else) that the default partition name will be set by IGN_PARTITION, and if that's not set or valid, it will be hostname() + ":" + username(); (if I understood well)

content.raw:
It is a bit confusing since it validates both a partition and namespace. You could:

1. Leave as is.
2. Create another function called `IsValidPartition` that internally calls `IsValidNamespace`
3. Rename `IsValidNamespace` to something else.

Your call.
content.html:
It is a bit confusing since it validates both a partition and namespace. You could:

  1. Leave as is.
  2. Create another function called IsValidPartition that internally calls IsValidNamespace
  3. Rename IsValidNamespace to something else.

Your call.

content.raw: Yes, `IsValidNamespace()` is used to validate partitions and namespaces. Maybe the name of the function is a bit confusing.
content.html: Yes, IsValidNamespace() is used to validate partitions and namespaces. Maybe the name of the function is a bit confusing.
